title: Fix DOCX image width - 7in specification not working
description:
The {width=7in} Pandoc markdown syntax doesn't actually set image width to 7 inches in generated DOCX files. Need to investigate Pandoc options or post-processing approach to enforce 7-inch image width in DOCX output.

Current behavior:
- Markdown: ![...](image.png){width=7in}
- Expected: Images render at 7 inches wide in DOCX
- Actual: Images render at default size (not 7 inches)

Possible solutions:
1. Pandoc reference document with proper image styles
2. Python-docx post-processing to resize images
3. Lua filter for Pandoc
4. Alternative DOCX generation approach

Files involved:
- docs/writing/*/drafts/*.docx
- .claude/skills/section-publish.md (Step 4b: RC generation)
- justify-docx.py (could extend to also resize images)

title: gemini-generate CLI: Variant #2 generated wrong topic (prompt isolation failure)
description: CRITICAL BUG in gemini-generate CLI: 33% failure rate (2/6 variants) generating wrong topics. Variants #2 and #5 both produced 'Bonnaroo iBeacon Engagement Gap' instead of 'Consent Architecture Spectrum'. Root cause: Prompt isolation failure in parallel tab generation - tabs not receiving independent prompts. Impact: Wastes generation time, requires regeneration, unreliable automation. Pattern: Seems to consistently affect middle variant (#2 of batch 1, #5 of batch 2). Need investigation of conversation URL detection and prompt submission isolation mechanism.
close_reason: Closed

title: Regenerate all analytics visuals in CONCISE mode
description: Regenerate all analytics section visuals using CONCISE mode and lessons learned from context-mismatch + crowd-success evaluations: 1) NO decorative boxes, 2) 40%+ white space target, 3) Minimal icons (only festival-context headers), 4) Electric coral for hero stats ONLY. Remove: legion-roi (too detailed), use-cases-matrix (overwhelming). Keep: traditional-vs-ai. Generate: dynamic-pricing-rejection, vendor-evaluation-framework.
